meanings.definition: Not capable of settling to the bottom of a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The light foam was nonsedimentable in the fizzy drink.
meanings.sent2: The oil was nonsedimentable in the water, floating effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The nonsedimentable bubbles in the soda seemed to dance on the surface.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like nonsedimentable joy, always staying afloat.
meanings.sent5: The nonsedimentable glitter sparkled in the sunlight, refusing to sink.

meanings.sent1: The clear liquid was nonsedimentable, showing no signs of settling.
meanings.sent2: The nonsedimentable solution remained crystal clear even after hours.
meanings.sent3: The nonsedimentable mud puzzled the geologists, defying their expectations.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were like nonsedimentable ideas, constantly in motion.
meanings.sent5: The nonsedimentable snow on the mountain peak glistened untouched by time.
